dlinputs.paths.extract_shards(url)[source]¶

Extract a shard list from a shard URL.

Shard URLs are URLs containing a string of the form @000123. This denotes that the shards are given by a six digit string and that there are 123 shards.

Parameters:url – shard url
Returns:list of URLs for shard
dlinputs.paths.find_basenames(top, extensions)[source]¶

Finds all basenames that have all the given extensions inside a tree.

Parameters:
  • top – root of directory tree
  • extensions – required extensions
Returns:

iterator over basenames
dlinputs.paths.find_directory(path, target='', tests=[], verbose=False, error=True)[source]¶

Finds the first instance of target on a path.

If tests is supplied, requires those targets to be present as well. This only works if the target is a directory.

Parameters:
  • path (list) – colon separated path along which to search or list
  • target (str) – target to search for (if empty, finds first path element that exists)
  • tests (list) – list of functions of additional predicates
  • verbose (bool) – output information about tests performed
  • error (bool) – not finding the target is an error
Returns:

path to target
Return type:

str
dlinputs.paths.find_file(path, target, tests=[], verbose=False, error=True)[source]¶

Finds the first instance of file on a path.

Parameters:
  • path (list) – colon separated path along which to search or list
  • target (str) – target to search for (if empty, finds first path element that exists)
  • tests (list) – list of functions of additional predicates
  • verbose (bool) – output information about tests performed
  • error (bool) – not finding the target is an error
Returns:

path to target
Return type:

str
dlinputs.paths.find_url(paths, extra=None)[source]¶

Given a list of url paths, find the first one that matches.

Parameters:
  • paths – list of base urls
  • extra – extra relative URL to be joined before testing
Returns:

first path that succeeds
dlinputs.paths.findurl(url)[source]¶

Finds a URL using environment variables for helpers.

If DLP_URLREWRITER is set in the environment, it is loaded. If dlinputs. url_rewriter is not None, it is applied to the url. If DLP_URLBASE is not None, it is joined to the url as a base url.

FIXME: make DLP_URLBASE a path

Parameters:url – url to locate
Returns:located URL
Return type:str
dlinputs.paths.iterate_shards(url)[source]¶

Iterates over shards.

Given a string of the form “prefix-@000123-suffix”, yields objects containing:

  • obj.name: expanded name
  • obj.prefix: prefix value
  • obj.index: index value (as zero-padded string)
  • obj.suffix: suffix value
Parameters:url – shard url
Returns:iterator over shards
dlinputs.paths.openurl(url)[source]¶

Open a URL with findurl followed by urlopen.

Parameters:url – url to be opened
Returns:result of urlopen
Return type:stream
dlinputs.paths.path_shards(path)[source]¶

Given a path shard spec, return an iterator over the shards.

dlinputs.paths.read_shards(url, shardtype='application/x-tgz', urlpath=None, verbose=True)[source]¶

Read a shards description file from a URL and convert relative URLs in shard file.

Parameters:
  • url – url to read shard file from (JSON format)
  • shardtype – default shard type
  • urlpath – path on which to search for the shard file
  • verbose – output progress
Returns:

list of URLs for shard
